TopicTitle: Should I attempt to make a 3d game?

Articles.Content:
I have had this idea of a really good 3D game that has yet to exist.

I am a good enough programmer to code this project...

Only thing is, I need a game engine. (I will not buy UTK.)

Anyone got any suggestions on a FREE game engine?
Unity is free. Why not use that?

Unity is free. Why not use that?

Hmmm let me check the site...

KSP does use unity...

Anyways, got it installed checking if I can make a Mars like object now...

Go for it, bro.

I\'ll be interested to see what you come up with.

Go for it, bro.

I\'ll be interested to see what you come up with.

Thanks.

Of course, this is NOTHING like KSP.

However,it is a mars based one.

How does actually unity works? I have always though it is drag&drop style program, not set of libraries.

I would suggest you picking up some low level stuff before you will start using full-featured engines. Sure they are for simplyfying life, but only when you are already good with doing it the hard way. *

* - own opinion, may cointain a lot of not true crap making things worse than better
sure, if you fail, youll learn not to try to ever be creative ever again.

sure, if you fail, youll learn not to try to ever be creative ever again.

No I just won\'t create the game myself...

I wish I could recommend this to a gaming company that actually takes game requests.

(I would give the idea to Squad but they\'ve already got there hands full...)

Cannot use Unity..

Time for 3DS max modeling.
use XNA game studio for C# just youtube the games ppl can make with it! and XNA is free

use XNA game studio for C# just youtube the games ppl can make with it! and XNA is free

XNA is not an engine, it is a graphics API.

You can get free XNA-based engines though... Try checking those out.

Well does anyone want to help with the project?

Well does anyone want to help with the project?

I still need ideas...

like i said in the PM im good at ideas for games! can i have a link to the site if you dont have the site you can join my site http://pirouline.webs.com/

Try UDK its free..... i think?

and good luck if you begin working on it

Basicly for all those people thinking unity is a drag and drop engine, it isn\'t. Yes you drag objects around the enviroment, scripts onto them and such like, but all those assets need to be made, eather scripted or modelled or drawn and suchlike. Unity just provides the librarys and enviroment to put these assets in.

Other engines are avalable. The Doom 3 engine (ID Tech 4 engine) is release as free with no documents to say otherwise, the UDK and unity have free licences (you are restricted by amount of money you make and suchlike) and the CryEngine is getting a free licence soon. The licences are restricting, but the free engines like the ID Tech 4 need more work done on them. It depends on you level of coding, amount of time and wether you will defy one of those restrictions latter on.
